column1:
welshysensei,"2016-03-08T07:01:49.77Z","Start your engines!","

LEGO Speed Champions has finally crossed the Atlantic and makes a great entrance with a pair of Camaros.
The box has clear photos of the models as well as photos of the actual cars for reference.
column2: They could have found a black and white classic Camaro instead of the orange one. &nbsp

column1: Lots of angles to create the sides, front and rear of the vehicles.
column2: The set includes a number of the 2x2 wings which are new. &nbsp
column5: bumpers which is a nice touch. &nbsp
column6: I feel like the axle pins are smoother than the 2015 cars. &nbsp
column8: The printed wheel centres are nice and you get an extra one, it will be a nice radiator cap on a future MOC.

column1: The female driver is a nice twist but she has a helmet and no hair.
column2: The others are fairly standard one sided mini fig heads.
The front of the new Camaro is pretty cleverly represented but it feels a little heavy in the back. &nbsp
column3: The classic Camaro is quite well done and captures the curve of the car quite well. &nbsp
column5: t have the larger rear tires so that you could have had 4 of the new wheel wells in black. &nbsp
column6: The starting gate has a nice light switch feature for race play. &nbsp
column7: You also get an air intake or a supercharger for the hood of the classic car.

column1: This line is plagued with stickers and these cars are no exception.
column2: The racing stripe on the middle of the older model looks good but the stickers don&#39
column3: t quite reach the width of the tiles. &nbsp
column4: They look good and are to scale with the others in the line.

column1: I am satisfied with the build and like the little details that are included on each car.
column2: I will probably put proper headlights in place of the stickers on the black Camaro.
